bug.author: fehiepsi
bug.summary: SVI failed with vectorize_particles=True in pytorch master
bug.description: With the BernoulliBetaTests, test_elbo_reparameterized failed if we use vectorize_particles=True (num_particles=2). It passed when we set vectorize_particles=False.

comments.comment: Is this the test in test_inference.py::BernoulliBetaTests.test_elbo_reparameterized? It runs fine with the following args for me. What's the margin of error you are getting? <denchmark-code> def test_elbo_reparameterized(self): self.do_elbo_test(True, 10000, Trace_ELBO(num_particles=2, vectorize_particles=True, max_iarange_nesting=1)) </denchmark-code>
Interesting, I cannot pass that test. The error is 0.0 vs 1.2. Maybe I am using Pytorch master. Let me check again.
Hah, it failed for pytorch master. I won't use pytorch master to test pyro anymore.
Its odd that itâ€™s failing on PyTorch master though. Will take a look.
So I change the title and reopen it again. :)

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/neerajprad>@neerajprad</denchmark-link> This is a pytorch bug, not a Pyro bug, so I'll close this. I raised the issue here: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/9521>pytorch/pytorch#9521</denchmark-link> .
Thanks for digging in, and creating the issue, <denchmark-link:https://github.com/fehiepsi>@fehiepsi</denchmark-link> .
